thread.title: How Parkland Survivors Started a Gun-Control Movement

author: Heather Seidel
title: How Parkland Survivors Started a Gun-Control Movement
text:
3 COMMENTS The students at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School are different from those who witnessed previous mass shootings at schools such as Columbine High School in 1999 or Virginia Tech in 2007. Theyâ€™re digital natives. They are harnessing the language and power of smartphones and social media. And that is one reason why the movement they started, dubbed #NeverAgain, has become a nationwide phenomenon so quickly.
The pressure they are helping build has created a potential opening for significant legislative action, in Florida and in Congress.
In the coming days and weeks, they have two public protests planned: a March 14 school walkout and a March 24 march on Washington, D.C.
For the video above, The Wall Street Journal spoke with some of the student activists on how they are working to build a grass-roots network of activists and a movement.
Read the full story here.
